title: 비자발적 종신 독재자 (Involuntary Dictator for Life)
selected_hypothesis: B (Unique Twist): The narrative hook is a 'Catastrophic Premise Shift'. It establishes a relatable 'get-rich-quick' fantasy only to violently pivot into a high-stakes survival/nation-building scenario, creating massive reader whiplash and engagement.

analysis_content.description: The first episode masterfully baits the reader with a common power fantasy: an ordinary but skilled professional (unemployed, from Silicon Valley) gets an unbelievably lucrative and powerful job through a lucky connection. The protagonist's motivation is purely financial, making his morally grey decision to work for a dictator highly relatable. This seemingly low-stakes 'office story' is a setup. The true 'Winning Formula', confirmed by the meta-data, is the impending violent incident (cabinet annihilation) that will destroy the existing power structure and force the unprepared protagonist into absolute authority. This bait-and-switch, a sudden genre shift from corporate fantasy to a political survival thriller, is the core engine of the hook.

evidence_from_text: "연봉으로 35만 달러는 어떻가? 숙식과 차량 일체를 제공해주고 말이야. (How about a salary of $350,000? With room, board, and a car provided.)" - This quote exemplifies the mundane, materialistic desire that baits the MC and reader. "내일부터 출근하겠습니다. 일이야 차차 배우면 되겠죠. 하하. (I'll start tomorrow. I guess I'll learn the work as I go. Haha.)" - This shows the MC's quick, almost naive acceptance, which builds a false sense of security right before the catastrophic event mentioned in the RAG.
actionable_insight: The initial premise doesn't have to be the *true* premise. Establish a stable, desirable situation for the protagonist in Episode 1, then violently destroy that stability to launch the real plot, maximizing shock value and reader investment.
